segments.pli: Aṅguttara Nikāya 4
segments.en: Numbered Discourses 4

segments.pli: 19. Brāhmaṇavagga
segments.en: 19. Brahmins

segments.pli: 185. Brāhmaṇasaccasutta
segments.en: 185. Truths of the Brahmins

segments.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā rājagahe viharati gijjhakūṭe pabbate.
segments.en: Once the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha, on the Vulture’s Peak Mountain.

segments.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sambahulā abhiññātā abhiññātā paribbājakā sippinikātīre paribbājakārāme paṭivasanti, seyyathidaṃ annabhāro varadharo sakuludāyī ca paribbājako aññe ca abhiññātā abhiññātā paribbājakā.
segments.en: Now at that time several very well-known wanderers were residing in the monastery of the wanderers on the bank of the Sappinī river. They included Annabhāra, Varadhara, Sakuludāyī, and other very well-known wanderers.

segments.pli: Atha kho bhagavā sāyanhasamayaṃ paṭisallānā vuṭṭhito yena sippinikātīre paribbājakārāmo tenupasaṅkami.
segments.en: Then in the late afternoon, the Buddha came out of retreat and went to the wanderer’s monastery on the bank of the Sappinī river.

segments.pli: Tena kho pana samayena tesaṃ aññatitthiyānaṃ paribbājakānaṃ sannisinnānaṃ sannipatitānaṃ ayamantarā kathā udapādi:
segments.en: Now at that time this discussion came up while those wanderers who follow other paths were sitting together,

segments.pli: “itipi brāhmaṇasaccāni, itipi brāhmaṇasaccānī”ti.
segments.en: “The truths of the brahmins are like this; the truths of the brahmins are like that.”

segments.pli: Atha kho bhagavā yena te paribbājakā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi. Nisajja kho bhagavā te paribbājake etadavoca:
segments.en: Then the Buddha went up to those wanderers, sat down on the seat spread out, and said to them,

segments.pli: “Kāya nuttha, paribbājakā, etarahi kathāya sannisinnā, kā ca pana vo antarākathā vippakatā”ti?
segments.en: “Wanderers, what were you sitting talking about just now? What conversation was unfinished?”

segments.pli: “Idha, bho gotama, amhākaṃ sannisinnānaṃ sannipatitānaṃ ayamantarākathā udapādi:
segments.en: “Well, Master Gotama, this discussion came up among us while we were sitting together:

segments.pli: ‘itipi brāhmaṇasaccāni, itipi brāhmaṇasaccānī’”ti.
segments.en: ‘The truths of the brahmins are like this; the truths of the brahmins are like that.’”

segments.pli: “Cattārimāni, paribbājakā, brāhmaṇasaccāni mayā sayaṃ abhiññā sacchikatvā paveditāni.
segments.en: “Wanderers, I declare these four truths of the brahmins, having realized them with my own insight.

segments.pli: Katamāni cattāri?
segments.en: What four?

segments.pli: Idha, paribbājakā, brāhmaṇo evamāha:
segments.en: Take a brahmin who says:

segments.pli: ‘sabbe pāṇā avajjhā’ti.
segments.en: ‘No sentient beings should be killed.’

segments.pli: Iti vadaṃ brāhmaṇo saccaṃ āha, no musā.
segments.en: Saying this, a brahmin speaks the truth, not lies.

segments.pli: So tena na samaṇoti maññati, na brāhmaṇoti maññati, na seyyohamasmīti maññati, na sadisohamasmīti maññati, na hīnohamasmīti maññati.
segments.en: But they don’t think of themselves as an ‘ascetic’ or ‘brahmin’ because of that. Nor do they think ‘I’m better’ or ‘I’m equal’ or ‘I’m worse’.

segments.pli: Api ca yadeva tattha saccaṃ tadabhiññāya pāṇānaṃyeva anuddayāya anukampāya paṭipanno hoti.
segments.en: Rather, they simply practice out of kindness and compassion for living creatures, having had insight into the truth of that.

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, paribbājakā, brāhmaṇo evamāha:
segments.en: Take another brahmin who says:

segments.pli: ‘sabbe kāmā aniccā dukkhā vipariṇāmadhammā’ti.
segments.en: ‘All sensual pleasures are impermanent, suffering, and perishable.’

segments.pli: Iti vadaṃ brāhmaṇo saccamāha, no musā.
segments.en: Saying this, a brahmin speaks the truth, not lies.

segments.pli: So tena na samaṇoti maññati, na brāhmaṇoti maññati, na seyyohamasmīti maññati, na sadisohamasmīti maññati, na hīnohamasmīti maññati.
segments.en: But they don’t think of themselves as an ‘ascetic’ or ‘brahmin’ because of that. Nor do they think ‘I’m better’ or ‘I’m equal’ or ‘I’m worse’.

segments.pli: Api ca yadeva tattha saccaṃ tadabhiññāya kāmānaṃyeva nibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya paṭipanno hoti.
segments.en: Rather, they simply practice for disillusionment, dispassion, and cessation regarding sensual pleasures, having had insight into the truth of that.

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, paribbājakā, brāhmaṇo evamāha:
segments.en: Take another brahmin who says:

segments.pli: ‘sabbe bhavā aniccā … pe … tadabhiññāya bhavānaṃyeva nibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya paṭipanno hoti.
segments.en: ‘All states of existence are impermanent, suffering, and perishable.’ … They simply practice for disillusionment, dispassion, and cessation regarding future lives, having had insight into the truth of that.

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, paribbājakā, brāhmaṇo evamāha:
segments.en: Take another brahmin who says:

segments.pli: ‘nāhaṃ kvacani kassaci kiñcanatasmiṃ na ca mama kvacani katthaci kiñcanatatthī’ti.
segments.en: ‘I don’t belong to anyone anywhere. And nothing belongs to me anywhere.’

segments.pli: Iti vadaṃ brāhmaṇo saccaṃ āha, no musā.
segments.en: Saying this, a brahmin speaks the truth, not lies.

segments.pli: So tena na samaṇoti maññati, na brāhmaṇoti maññati, na seyyohamasmīti maññati, na sadisohamasmīti maññati, na hīnohamasmīti maññati.
segments.en: But they don’t think of themselves as an ‘ascetic’ or ‘brahmin’ because of that. Nor do they think ‘I’m better’ or ‘I’m equal’ or ‘I’m worse’.

segments.pli: Api ca yadeva tattha saccaṃ tadabhiññāya ākiñcaññaṃyeva paṭipadaṃ paṭipanno hoti.
segments.en: Rather, they simply practice the path of nothingness, having had insight into the truth of that.

segments.pli: Imāni kho, paribbājakā, cattāri brāhmaṇasaccāni mayā sayaṃ abhiññā sacchikatvā paveditānī”ti.
segments.en: These are the four truths of the brahmins that I declare, having realized them with my own insight.”

segments.pli: Pañcamaṃ.
